TEXT: The applicants , PERSON and PERSON and PERSON , are NORP nationals . They were born in DATE , DATE and DATE , respectively . They live in GPE and PERSON , respectively . They were represented before the ORG by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . The respondent Government were represented by their agent Ambassador PERSON , Head of ORG at ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

Upon the ORG request ORG sitting as a ORG ( GPE als GPE - und ORG ) on DATE and on DATE , respectively , ordered the F company to pay ( PERSON ) the first applicant CARDINAL ORG , the second applicant CARDINAL ORG and the third applicant CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL ORG . On DATE these orders became enforceable .
On DATE ORG opened bankruptcy proceedings concerning the F company . This decision was published in the bankruptcy data base ( ORG ) in the internet on DATE .

On DATE the applicants requested ORG ( Bezirksgericht ) to enforce the above - mentioned payment orders by selling the F company ’s movable property ( Fahrnisexekution ) and by granting the applicants a lien on outstanding accounts which the F company held against GPE , GPE and GPE ( PERSON ) .

On DATE ORG granted this application and ordered enforcement of the payment orders ( Exekutionsbewilligung ) under Sections CARDINAL and CARDINAL of LAW ( Exekutionsordnung ) . It appears that ORG apparently disregarded LAW ( see Relevant domestic law and practice ) when it granted this request .

On DATE ORG , GPE and GPE , who were debtors of the F company and against whom that company had outstanding claims , appealed against this decision . They submitted that the enforcement order was unlawful as bankruptcy proceedings against the F company had been opened on DATE and that , following the decision to open bankruptcy proceedings , they were no longer allowed to honour individual request for enforcement . The appeals were not transmitted to the applicants .
At DATE the bankruptcy trustee , referring to LAW ( GPE ) , requested ORG to cancel enforcement proceedings .

With decisions of DATE and DATE respectively , ORG remitted the file back to ORG as it found that the appeals of DATE needed improvement . On CARDINAL and DATE respectively these decisions were served on the applicants’ counsel .
ORG , GPE and GPE subsequently remedied the defects of the appeals . The appeals were not transmitted to the applicants .

With decisions of DATE , DATE and DATE ORG rejected the appeals concerning the enforcement of the order to pay by selling the F company ’s movable property , as it noted that GPE , GPE and GPE had no legal standing in this regard , because they were not affected by that part of the order .

It granted , however , the appeals concerning the enforcement of the order to pay by granting a lien on the F company ’s outstanding accounts against NORP , GPE and GPE It referred in this regard to LAW . The court further noted that , according to relevant case - law and doctrine , it was for the person requesting an enforcement order to substantiate already in the application why enforcement under LAW should be admissible irrespective of the opening of the bankruptcy proceedings . In the present case , the applicants had not made such submissions in their applications . ORG had opened bankruptcy proceedings against the F company on CARDINAL DATE . This decision had been published in the bankruptcy data base ( ORG ) on DATE . The enforcement order had been issued only on DATE and was therefore unlawful . The court further noted that the applicants had filed their request for enforcement of the payment order on DATE , although bankruptcy proceedings had already been pending at this time . It therefore ordered them to reimburse the costs of the appeal proceedings , i.e. CARDINAL ORG to be paid by the first applicant , CARDINAL ORG to be paid by the second applicant , and CARDINAL ORG to be paid by the third applicant .
The enforcement of judicial decisions is regulated by LAW ( Exekutionsordnung ) , which provides for the satisfaction of a pecuniary claim by seizure of individual assets of the debtor ( ORG ) .

However , after the commencement of bankruptcy proceedings against the debtor , individual satisfaction of a creditor gives way to collective satisfaction on a quota basis of all creditors with pecuniary claims ( Generalexekution ) . The execution of an individual claim under LAW is in principle no longer possible .

Accordingly , LAW stipulates that , after the commencement of bankruptcy , no right to a lien or to a payment may be obtained from a court in respect of assets forming the bankrupt ’s estate on account of a claim against the bankrupt . According to LAW , bankruptcy shall take effect from DATE following its official publication .
